name: Nezumi Shadow-Watcher
text: Sacrifice Nezumi Shadow-Watcher: Destroy target Ninja.

editions.flavor:
"The Okiba Gang! Night-cursed thieves and assassins! I've had enough of their meddling! Triple the guard!"
—Marrow-Gnawer

name: Nezumi Shortfang
text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Then if that player has no cards in hand, flip Nezumi Shortfang.

name: Niall Silvain
text: {G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: This is his domain, and while you remain here you must value all life as you value your own.

name: Niblis of Dusk
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: It fuels its lanterns by leaching the warmth from its surroundings.

name: Niblis of Frost
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Niblis of the Breath
text:
Flying
{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Why do the dead remain among us? Where is Flight Alabaster to lead them home? Where is Avacyn?"
—Eruth of Lambholt

name: Niblis of the Mist
text:
Flying
When Niblis of the Mist enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Not even a roaring fire could thaw the chill it put in my heart."
—Vonn, geist-trapper

name: Niblis of the Urn
text:
Flying
Whenever Niblis of the Urn attacks, you may tap target creature.

editions.flavor:
"I never had the nerve to open that bottle. I'll bet you're wishing right now you hadn't been so curious yourself."
—Old Rutstein

name: Nice
text: Search your library for a card and put it into another target player's hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Nicol Bolas
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nicol Bolas unless you pay {U}{B}{R}.
Whenever Nicol Bolas deals damage to an opponent, that player discards his or her hand.

editions.flavor: Dominaria's most ancient evil.

+3: Destroy target noncreature permanent.

name: Night
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

text:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Shiny polished silver can ward off many creatures, but it attracts others.

name: Nightcreep
text: Until end of turn, all creatures become black and all lands become Swamps.

editions.flavor:
"Please tell me I'm hallucinating. I'd rather be crazy than here."
—Gorev Hadszak, Wojek investigator

name: Night Dealings
text:
Whenever a source you control deals damage to another player, put that many theft counters on Night Dealings.
{2}{B}{B}, Remove X theft counters from Night Dealings: Search your library for a nonland card with converted mana cost X, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Nighteyes the Desecrator
text: {4}{B}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

name: Nightfall Predator
text:
{R}, {T}: Nightfall Predator fights target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Nightfall Predator.

name: Nightfire Giant
text:
Nightfire Giant gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
{4}{R}: Nightfire Giant deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Nightfire turns the greatest weakness of the undead into formidable strength.

name: Nightguard Patrol
text: First strike, vigilance

editions.flavor: "The Wojek defend the laws. We defend the people."

name: Nighthaze
text:
Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"To evade the brood lineages, one must be made dark to all the senses."
—Traga, Zulaport runner

text:
Bestow {2}{B}{B} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Nighthowler and enchanted creature each get +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.

Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

text: Search target player's library for up to X cards, where X is the number of Swamps you control, and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Nightmare Lash
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each Swamp you control.
Equip—Pay 3 life. (Pay 3 life: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

name: Nightmare Void
text:
Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

name: Nightmarish End
text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor:
"To think some believe it peaceful to die in one's sleep."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver

name: Night Market Aeronaut
text:
Flying
Revolt — Night Market Aeronaut enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

editions.flavor: "Death might come tomorrow, but today—today I am alive."

name: Night Market Guard
text: Night Market Guard can block an additional creature each combat.

editions.flavor:
"One head watches for Consulate enforcers. The other watches for renegade thieves."
—Crime Lord Gonti

name: Night Market Lookout
text: Whenever Night Market Lookout becomes tapped, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The Consulate rarely cracks the coded announcement of a night market's location before dawn, and enforcers are taken care of if they wander too close.

name: Night of Souls' Betrayal
text: All creatures get -1/-1.

editions.flavor:
"How can we wage war against ourselves? What happens when the kami of our very souls rise against us? I answer simply: We cannot. We die. There can be no victory in this war."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

name: Night Revelers
text: Night Revelers has haste as long as an opponent controls a Human.

editions.flavor: Vampires think of themselves as the indisputable nobility of Innistrad, able to do as they please. There are few who can prove them wrong.

name: Nightscape Apprentice
text:
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.
{R}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

name: Nightscape Battlemage
text:
Kicker {2}{U} and/or {2}{R} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} and/or {2}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Nightscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, return up to two target nonblack creatures to their owners' hands.
When Nightscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{R} kicker, destroy target land.

name: Nightscape Familiar
text:
Blue spells and red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Nightscape Familiar.

editions.flavor: Nightscape masters don't stop at raising the spirit of a fallen battlemage. They raise the flesh along with it.

text:
{U}{U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
{R}{R}, {T}: Nightscape Master deals 2 damage to target creature.

name: Nightshade Assassin
text:
First strike
When Nightshade Assassin enters the battlefield, you may reveal X black cards in your hand. If you do, target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.
Madness {1}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Nightshade Peddler
text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Nightshade Peddler is paired with another creature, both creatures have deathtouch.

name: Nightshade Schemers
text:
Flying
Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Nightshade Schemers, you may reveal it. If you do, each opponent loses 2 life.

name: Nightshade Seer
text: {2}{B}, {T}: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

name: Nightshade Stinger
text:
Flying
Nightshade Stinger can't block.

editions.flavor:
"Most faeries are harmless pranksters. Every now and again, though, you get one that crosses over from mischievous to malicious."
—Gaddock Teeg

name: Nightsky Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both white and black, Nightsky Mimic has base power and toughness 4/4 until end of turn and gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A mimic need only touch a being to learn its shape, but touching usually leads to mauling and messily eating.

name: Nightsnare
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a nonland card from it. If you do, that player discards that card. If you don't, that player discards two cards.

editions.flavor: Ravnica would be safer if mere coin was all the Dimir could steal.

name: Night Soil
text: {1}, Exile two creature cards from a single graveyard: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

editions.flavor: The elves gathered huge piles of rot to grow fungus. Out of imitation or forethought, the thallids did the same.
The Elves gathered huge piles of rot to grow fungus. Out of imitation or forethought, the Thallids did the same.
Some said killing the Thallids only encouraged them.

"There were often more Thallids after a battle than before."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III
Some said killing the thallids only encouraged them.

name: Nightsoil Kami
text: Soulshift 5 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Nightstalker Engine
text: Nightstalker Engine's power is equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Part metal, part bone, and all death.

name: Night's Whisper
text: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"I have seen things that would reduce a weaker person to blubbering and raving. Want to hear about them?"
—Vraska
The Moriok call the black moon the Whisperer. At her apex, she whispers of power.

"I have seen things that would reduce a weaker person to blubbering and raving. Want to hear about them?"
—Vraska

name: Night Terrors
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.

editions.flavor: Innistrad is a place where dreams invade the mind and mere shadows exact a terrible toll.
Innistrad is a place where dreams invade the mind and mere shadows exact a terrible toll.

text:
Flying
Whenever Nightveil Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.
You may play cards exiled with Nightveil Specter.

name: Nightwind Glider
text: Flying, protection from black

editions.flavor: Once you learn to float on the shadows, you'll never fear them again.

name: Nightwing Shade
text:
Flying
{1}{B}: Nightwing Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"There is one hour of the night even we do not watch."

—Sedva, captain of the watch

name: Nihilistic Glee
text:
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Hellbent — {1}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.

editions.flavor: "All ends in obliteration—love in hatred, life in death, and light in empty darkness."

name: Nihilith
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Suspend 7—{1}{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{B} and exile it with seven time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, if Nihilith is suspended, you may remove a time counter from Nihilith.

name: Nihil Spellbomb
text:
{T}, Sacrifice Nihil Spellbomb: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

name: Nikko-Onna
text:
When Nikko-Onna enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Nikko-Onna to its owner's hand.

name: Nim Abomination
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Nim Abomination is untapped, you lose 3 life.

editions.flavor: It is one of the oldest nim, steeped so long in the Dross that it has lost all vestiges of humanity.

name: Nimana Sell-Sword
text: Whenever Nimana Sell-Sword or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Nimana Sell-Sword.

editions.flavor:
"He asked if I had work for him. No wasn't the right answer."
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Nimble-Blade Khenra
text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"In the Hour of Glory, the gods and the untested will prove their worth before the God-Pharaoh."
—The Accounting of Hours

name: Nimble Innovator
text: When Nimble Innovator enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "A failure is simply another opportunity for improvement. Just wait until you see what I come up with next."

name: Nimble Mongoose
text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Threshold — Nimble Mongoose gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: One thread connected all the travelers' stories: the ferocity of the mongoose.
Faster than a cobra's bite.

name: Nimbus Maze
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control an Island.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control a Plains.

editions.flavor: To find its center is to find one's own.

name: Nimbus Naiad
text:
Bestow {4}{U} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Flying
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.

name: Nimbus of the Isles
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

editions.flavor: The people of the Sevick Isles have a unique understanding of the term "ominous clouds."

name: Nimbus Swimmer
text:
Flying
Nimbus Swimmer enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: The Simic soon discovered that the sky offered as few constraints on size as the sea.
The Simic soon discovered that the sky offered as few constraints on size as the sea.

name: Nimbus Wings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has flying.

editions.flavor: Explorers may find ways into the Sky Ruin, but they find its secrets well protected by shifting hedrons and Roil winds.

name: Nim Deathmantle
Nim Devourer
text:
Nim Devourer gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
{B}{B}: Return Nim Devourer from your graveyard to the battlefield, then sacrifice a creature. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Nim Grotesque
text: Nim Grotesque gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.

editions.flavor: In the swirling mists, you could walk right up to one and not know until its teeth are in your throat.

name: Nim Lasher
text: Nim Lasher gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.

editions.flavor: The rotting metal feeds the necrogen mists, and in turn the mists feed the nim.

name: Nim Replica
text: {2}{B}, Sacrifice Nim Replica: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It kills with unfeeling malice.

name: Nim Shambler
text:
Nim Shambler gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Nim Shambler.

editions.flavor: Called "the Dross" by its inhabitants, Mephidross is home to the nim, Mirrodin's mindless, ravenous undead.

name: Nim Shrieker
text:
Flying
Nim Shrieker gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.

editions.flavor: As imps they were an annoyance. As nim they are a pestilence.

name: Nine-Ringed Bo
text: {T}: Nine-Ringed Bo deals 1 damage to target Spirit creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

editions.flavor:
"We received an anonymous letter suggesting that Kumano holds a secret to defeating the kami, but he is nowhere to be found."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda

name: Ninja of the Deep Hours
text:
Ninjutsu {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Ninja of the Deep Hours deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

name: Ninth Bridge Patrol
text: Whenever another creature you control leaves the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Ninth Bridge Patrol.

editions.flavor: The Consulate keeps watch at each of the eleven bridges to ensure that the market remains a haven for commerce, not for con artists.

name: Nin, the Pain Artist
text: {X}{U}{R}, {T}: Nin, the Pain Artist deals X damage to target creature. That creature's controller draws X cards.

editions.flavor: "Your body is a delicate instrument that tells me truths. These devices help me ‘tune' that instrument."

name: Nip Gwyllion
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: Once your life and all your worldly possessions have been surrendered to her, a gwyllion can be surprisingly civilized.

name: Nirkana Assassin
text: Whenever you gain life, Nirkana Assassin gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Nirkana assassins craft incurable concoctions by mixing basilisk marrow and deathwillow sap with the vital fluids of a dozen other poisonous species.

name: Nirkana Cutthroat
text:
Level up {2}{B} ({2}{B}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)

4/3
Deathtouch

5/4

name: Nirkana Revenant
text:
Whenever you tap a Swamp for mana, add {B} to your mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
{B}: Nirkana Revenant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Hate is an everlasting wellspring from which it is eternally sustained.

name: Nissa, Nature's Artisan
text:
+3: You gain 3 life.
−4: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put all land cards from among them onto the battlefield and the rest into your hand.
−12: Creatures you control get +5/+5 and gain trample until end of turn.

name: Nissa Revane
text:
+1: Search your library for a card named Nissa's Chosen and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
+1: You gain 2 life for each Elf you control.
−7: Search your library for any number of Elf creature cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Nissa, Sage Animist
text:
+1: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.
−2: Create a legendary 4/4 green Elemental creature token named Ashaya, the Awoken World.
−7: Untap up to six target lands. They become 6/6 Elemental creatures. They're still lands.

name: Nissa's Chosen
text: If Nissa's Chosen would die, put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: Once, Nissa selected worthy fighters to defend the Joraga. Now, she gathers forces to defend all of Zendikar.
"Nissa will save the elves, but only the ones who have proved their worth."

name: Nissa's Expedition
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

name: Nissa's Judgment
text:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Choose up to one target creature an opponent controls. Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it deals damage equal to its power to that creature.

name: Nissa's Pilgrimage
text:
Search your library for up to two basic Forest cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, search your library for up to three basic Forest cards instead of two.

name: Nissa's Renewal
text: Search your library for up to three basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. You gain 7 life.

editions.flavor: Her connection to the plane restored, Nissa felt the power of Zendikar surge through her.
Her connection to the plane restored, Nissa felt the power of Zendikar surge through her.

name: Nissa's Revelation
text: Scry 5, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you draw cards equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.

editions.flavor: The evil inside the mountain pulsed at Nissa in a shock wave of madness.
The evil inside the mountain pulsed at Nissa in a shock wave of madness.

name: Nissa, Steward of Elements
text:
+2: Scry 2.
0: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card or a creature card with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of loyalty counters on Nissa, Steward of Elements, you may put that card onto the battlefield.
−6: Untap up to two target lands you control. They become 5/5 Elemental creatures with flying and haste until end of turn. They're still lands.

text:
When Nissa, Vastwood Seer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, if you control seven or more lands, exile Nissa, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control.

text:
+1: Untap target land you control. Until your next turn, it becomes a 5/5 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.
−3: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
−6: You get an emblem with "Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card."

−7: You gain X life and draw X cards, where X is the number of lands you control.

text:

−7: Search your library for any number of basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Those lands become 4/4 Elemental creatures with trample. They're still lands.

name: Niveous Wisps
text:
Target creature becomes white until end of turn. Tap that creature.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: In a world devoid of sun, illumination comes from cheerless fires or the wandering spirits of the dead.

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}{U}{R}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until your next turn, you may cast that card if it's an instant or sorcery card.

text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

Defender

{2}{U}{R}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy.

"The only action worth taking is one with an unknown outcome."
